WRITING.TITLE: What mods have an active player base?

But not every idiot can be funny or entertaining. I and a lot of other people find these guys assuming. I also do not watch ever JR podcast.Though I think watched every political guest, and I never really got upset personally.

Aren't transgender people like 1% of the population or something like that? Why is this such a hot issue in America, I just can't bring myself to give a fuck where Trans people go to bathroom.

Look if Trump was a snowflake he wouldn't go and debate with Hillary or the other GOP candidates face to face. That's essentially an antithesis of special snowflake.
So starting a war with the media is just not equivalent to some millennial wanting special safe space because they heard that somebody in the college might imply there aren't 912931 genders.

Americans are getting to learn lots of new things since the election. Like the Russia/S.Arabia thing, it feels so magnificently ironic to see how they react when another country is influencing their elections.
I hope the OP understand that there is no pattern for people in this thread. To its most fundamental core its people that despise extreme politics and people that adamantly insist on free speech.

Looking at the posts here Gavin was so goddamn on point about leftist being butthurt. 90% of the podcast is him and Joe fucking around having a good time like normal people, and here this thread is full of post dissecting every little thing he said and "totally" proving him wrong, or taking him of context or not getting that he is simply kidding around.
Jeez, like, have you ever talked to someone in your real life? Do you fact check every thing you say when you're having a friendly conversation? Do you make sure your jokes stand up to 100% science? Are you making sure your words are always consistent with your previous statements? Give me a fucking break, and maybe re-discover what is the Joe Rogan podcast.

I think he can be a lots of things but not Conservative.
He thinks marriage is bullshit, god is bullshit, banning thing is bullshit, societal valuse are bullshit... etc...
He's pro LGBT, guns, drugs, marriage of whatever... Essentially the mean hates closed mind points.
Well lately he's mention it in a rather positive light.
I know more "leftist" that use that term, by far. With that they mean the new disgusting regressive left that can't handle somebody talking about something they do not like.
Trump complains and whines like a juvenile, yes. But he doesn't claim he's traumatized and needs safe space from a mean word he saw on twitter.
All I see on Joe's facebook page and in this subreddit is complaining that Joe is just bringing the "far right" conservatives.
Well Joe is too, I just think they see it differently.

Peterson tribalist? I thought Peterson was suggesting that socialism is a slippery slope that will eventually lead into the USSR like state. I can see why that maybe wrong, but I don't think he had extreme thoughts or fears as you were implying.

I'm surprised he wasn't on yet.
Funny, Jon Stewart made me completely misunderstand American politics as an outsider. The way he presented it to me was, you have the degenerate retarded Republicans that live in the 19ct, CNN FOX that are the scum of the earth and the rest...
For the longest time I couldn't figure out how is there any voters for the Republican party in the 21ct.

I am not. I'm just suggesting that Russia could have had a similar form of rule as the UK. I'm not putting my money on it...
Why is everyone taking my posts at face value in this sub-reddit.

The Mongols, Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealht, Swedish Baltic Empire and Napoleon beg to differ.
And In past 200 years it was either Napoleon/France, Germany or Russia, Britain was always mostly a naval force. It never had a big land military force.
I don't mean to demean people dying, I just want to make it clear that we are less barbarous as time goes, even with the advent of modern weapons.

I'm american. I can tell you how we'd react. Nope, sorry that doesn't make you any way expert on the matter. First and biggest issue I take with that is that an "American" is a very loose term, I find it hard to believe Californians would behave the same as people from Texas in case of a foreign invasion.
The most powerful military was the british, french and soviets in ww2...
I meant, that roughly every 50 something years, Russia has been invaded by the most powerful military in Europe/World AT THE TIME. That's not something to scoff at, it created a strong patriotic culture, where it was expected to give blood and guts for your Motherland. Even if it means burning down everything you know so the enemy won't get it.
Personally I think, the southern states would fight to the last, and the East coast would give some descent opposition, but the rest, I'm not so sure.
I really do not understand why is it difficult to make the goddamn attachments and magazines the same skin color? Why is that a controversial opinion to have?

I still find that statistic dodgy. I visited places with much more Christian grip and superstition but people do not question evolution and its thought in all schools.
Though that might be because the Orthodox church is so out of touch with reality and its followers are just not that "philosophical" about that.

You can't know how the US would react really, you have like two real "invasions" of US soil, and even they are laughable in comparison to Russia which until WW2 had to fend off an invasion every 50 years, usually by the most powerful military in Europe.
I don't think it would be unbelievable if Russia with a Tsar would basically be like the UK by the time of 1939. Basically a democracy or a republic with a Tsar as a figurehead.
You got that from which movie/video game?
I can't stress that enough to people, that even with WW1 and WW2 the amount of deaths in war is laughable in the 20ct compared to previous ones.

As a kid and even a bit today I was bothered how the Jews were the only getting the "Sympathy card" about WW2. Like they were the only one that suffered and got the bad end of the stick in WW2. While Americans were the only ones getting the "Bravery card".
Fortunately one thing my school did right is educate about the suffering of all people in WW2 and the ridiculous amount of casualties in USSR, Poland and Yugoslavia, and how they overcame probably the greatest evil in human history. I mean the battles and the viciousness in the Eastern front...
Yes we did learn how fucked up USSR was too, but its ideology wasn't "evil" just the men on top.

I like Neil, he is fun. But the latest podcast has a good example what bothers me not so much about him but about his audience (Americans?).
He explains to Joe what fucking Winter Solstice is, are you fucking kidding me? Are American schools that bad? I was thought that in grad school when I was like 8 years or something like that.

I really don't like that Joe thinks of NdT as some kind intellectual messiah.
He said that he should be one of the "council of wise" that runs the USA... I mean, c'mon dude...
I never had any problem with Breitbart and Milo, but damn, I see they have as much balls as the regressive left they make fun of so much.

When people say feminism, I want them to think of this and Kurdish women fighting ISIS, not some red haired screeching cunt.
That said I hate poachers with a fury of a thousand supernovas, but one thing we have take into consideration. There is a difference between a poacher that kills a rhino so some fat Chinese millionaire can get his dick up and a poacher that kills an animal to sell or even give to a starving village.
I am not saying the second one is ok, but its a symptom of a complex problem, that should be fixable. I mean, I can't force myself to hate someone that kills protected animals or buys poached meat to feed their loved ones.
Still fits, no? xD

I forgot hip hop. That also had a huge influence on the youth. The "gangsta street culture" really took off in some Slavic countries I visited. Snoop Dog or for example Rick Ross collaborated with some of them.
What I think is that the influences are many and different, so its a really complex picture.
- Oh, I forgot. When I was a kid, every summer we had this black kid coming from Germany, whenever somebody meet him for the first time, they were a bit "enchanted?" by his skin and hair, but as time moved on, he was the "German kid". Like we treated him as a foreigner from Germany, because he spoke with a German accent and talked to us about Germany.

I always assumed machine guns are more for suppression, and that shrapnel kills or hurts most soldiers.
As for your last point, its really scary, it is not rare that on the top of the scoreboard there are a few snipers/lmgs that just waste us. The book will sell, that is certain by now, but the publishers are afraid of their precious "prestige", that nobody really cares about when you think about it.

Another thing about the gay parade in Belgrade is, that its the same football hooligans and street trash that will try to disrupt the parade. In fact most of violent incidents in the country are their doings.
So I think that situation, really doesn't reflect some rampant violent homophobia in Serbia. Yes most of people are against the parade but they are not violent about it or towards gays. In essence the homophobia does exist, but its not mass open violence.

I made a silly joke, chill.

WRITING.TITLE: Hollywood, please take notes from Adorea on how to direct swordfights!
I feel that this game's player base is not "balanced".
WRITING.TEXT:
I have been playing for a few days this game, and I've noticed a lot time there is lots of kills by a few lmgs over 100m. They usually hide somewhere and just shred people.
But actually they do not shred, its more like a sting. I never see any muzzle flash, I barely, just barely hear some burst fire and I'm dead or a teammate of mine.
So far the only thing that seems to deal with them are tanks and smoke grenades. I just have no idea what to do when up against them and maybe I don't know WW2 weapons that well, but I just don't understand why is an LMG this quiet and stealthy over 50-100m. Dozens of players get killed by it (several times) without even being able to guess where its shooting from I think one big fear about this game I had came true, its too goddamn niche.
You either have these super vets that have over 1k visits to the server, or poor newbies like me that barely started. Then I suppose the recruits get discouraged by crazy high level of skill (seriously the accuracy and reflexes are insane), leave the game and then you have such small even more niche community.
Because, I'm not sure how many times more I will "have fun" by getting killed from 150 meters by a freakin' smg or the instance the pixel of my body reveals itself.
So far I really hope I got the wrong servers, but its getting harder and harder to rely on that.
P.S. What I would really like to see is a post-battle killcam of all the times I've got killed or something like that, I really want to know how the hell I get killed sometimes.
EDIT: After playing some more, I've gotta say I got even more frustrated. I got killed by automated weapons from huge distances, and it seems the second I peak or even flank one of the players, they get instantly turn and kill me. One player raked up over 70 kills with an lmg, and I saw him ONCE, like I actually saw him once shoot.
I think smgs are starting to piss me off even more, since they seem to have no drawbacks, I get starched by them with ease both close quarters and long distance. How is that supposed to be realistic and immersive? When a player can insta kill me with an MP40 over 50m? That tops even the smart guns in Alien movies games. I'm starting to think that weapons are way toooo accurate.
**EDIT 2** :
I have to applaud this subreddit, hands down one of the best I ever I had the pleasure of communicating.
So with the advises of people here I got better to a degree (cake slice was very useful and intuitive). But please understand, maybe my post came of as criticism of the game but now I am definitely sure the game is not that much of a problem. Its just the number of players. When I play on the server, I often see players joining that at least had a 100 visits to this server. A lot of them are over 1k. So that is a bit brutal and unfair. I just feel like if I had more games with in which the player base is mostly beginners, they would be more fun. I think that is the recipe for fun in most of multiplayer games, I myself on a lot of MP(not just FPS) games always disliked playing against players way bellow me or way above me, it is usually near my skill level that gets the most entertaining results. I mean it would be also kinda hilarious seeing two squads facing each other, have no goddamn idea what to do and their veteran leaders constantly face palming!
This of course is not something the developers can't fix, at least not easily and directly, I am just afraid, because this is usually a sign of a dying community, so I hope the new Vietnam game will revitalize the franchise.

WRITING.TITLE: How much of a contrast would be between the Old Kingdom and Central Europe?
WRITING.TEXT:
Can you imagine an expedition from the Old Kingdom or a Mesopotamian civilization through the Danube. I think that if that really happened and was somehow recorded for us to read today, it must have been the most epic clash of worlds ever recorded. I am not an expert by any means on the period, but I am pretty sure that the differences would be immense. For the Egyptians it would have probably felt like visiting some ancient wild world full of danger and mystery. I doubt bronze would have been wide spreed then in central Europe. I would venture so far as to suggest it might as well have been a late stone age.
Anyway, I would pay a ticket to watch that movie or movie/documentary. You don't need fantasy really, when you human history at times can be even more bizarre.
Just imagine an Egyptian trying to explain what an Pyramid is to some of the "natives", or Egyptians seeing the wild forests full of unbelievable beasts or feeling the cold of Europe. Anyway, if somebody is knowledgeable on the subject, why not offer some other potential interesting reactions or thoughts if this happened.

WRITING.TITLE: [NO SPOILERS] I don't get people who complain about the "brutal" scenes in GoT and claim to be fans of the show.
WRITING.TEXT:
Maybe its not the fans, maybe its the outside media and occasional viewers, but God almighty I remember being so frustrated with the constant whining, complaining and nagging at GoT writers or directors. I thought that by the end of season 3(1) we established two things about the show :
- Your FAV character is not safe.
- Brutal and gruesome things are gonna happen.
For me the final straw was, some movie/comic/tvshow critics praising season 6 as the BEST season. Okay, I can live with that, but when they started explaining why they liked it, it was basically : "YAAAY FOR THE GOOD GUYS AND NICE STUFF IS HAPPENING".
GoT is not Star Wars, haven't you got the memo by now?
Second thing that got me off the rails, is death of one major character after season 3. For crying out loud, how can you still be shocked with this? How??? Have you missed all the tabloid and media shit storms about every death previously and how they were unexpected and how "fans" reacted?
What is the reason you are watching GoT? Twist deaths and brutal scenes are part of its shtick, like new spells in Harry Poter or new tech in Iron Man, just think for one second and you don't have to overact every time it happens, because when you do I think people should question your intelligence. These are not some intricate plots hidden in the subtext, it is what everybody is talking about, because its a climax and a trend in the sowh. Honestly for all the praise GoT gets, a lot of its viewer base reminds me on the soap operas and teen-vampire shit. "OOH THEY HOOKED UP AGAIN, OOOH NOH THEY KISSED, OOOH THEY ARE BREAKING UP AGAIN' week after week.
Why this worries me, is that these backlashes discourage GoT and other TV shows from doing their thing. A good outside example would be whining about the "torture porn" in the latest Walking Dead season, Jesus Christ I adamantly hate torture porn, yet I thought that the violence was kind of meh, not that gruesome really.
Again, I think the main problem comes from people watching too much tame media, they hear the hype, they come to see this piece of art, then they complain how it doesn't adhere to their special standards of entertainment.

WRITING.TITLE: J.F. Sargent from Cracked "totally debunks" Dave Rubin's video!
ELI5:Why do we find bears cute?
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]

WRITING.TITLE: Has there been a human culture, that worshiped whales or had them as some form of deity?
WRITING.TEXT:
Probably one of the most majestic creatures that live on the Earth, and one of the largest species. You would think they would be worshiped before elephants, lions, bears or cows. I guess there were some cultures around the Polar belt that deified whales.
My guess for why weren't they worshiped is probably technology or lack there off. By the time humans could travel the Ocean in mass, the monotheistic religions had a firm grip, and I don't think that humans were able to hear whale songs until recently. Another reason is that, how many individuals could have seen a whale under water swimming? Hardly much.
Its just interesting for me, I guess I asked this out of mild desperation, but whales do seem to me a like huge missed opportunity of culture. If I as a primitive hunter gatherer or even Bronze age individual had some kind of knowledge of their size, movement, songs and virtual lack of predators (other than you know killer whales who are technically dolphins but still). My guess that sure as hell they would be my gods, if my culture attributed animals to Gods. Can you just imagine sailors of some ancient seafaring culture, seeing a sperm whale killing a collosal squid? What do you think the impact would have been? I would put my money on a "protector god killing the demon or devil". Of course those battles take places deep bellow the ocean so...
With that, I can't stop thinking but what awesome myths, legends or feats of art we missed. Like sculptures, statues, architectural feats, maybe even music inspired by whale songs or various forms of imagery.
God damn you technology nature for screwing us over like this.

WRITING.TITLE: In what order should I read Robert. E. Howard's Conan stories? Is there a proper way?
WRITING.TEXT:
I want to read Conan stories and I am even 100% sure that I'm gonna read some books, so I don't think I am breaking the sub-reddit's rules. I'm not giving some vague description and asking for a book based on it, I just need a bit clarification and even discussion. It might help somebody else down the line.
Reading Conan books might be messy experience if I do not ask for advice from somebody who did it already. I basically want to follow a clear chronological order and one clear continuity or canon. It would really be a bummer if I read some short story or even a novel that doesn't have much to do with the Conan mythos.
I also wonder should I try to find some comics, since if they have identical story and lines to the books but amazing art, I could try them out. I understand this is a books subreddit, but the comic books subreddit could also delete my post because its about books. So what am I supposed to do then? I figured since Conan is original a pulp character,a book subreddit is a better place.
P.S. What is the point of so many sub-reddits about books? There is even a /r/BookDiscussion, I thought this one is about book discussions?

WRITING.TITLE: How do I play this?
WRITING.TEXT:
I keep joining in middle of missions with random people that do not speak english, so how the fuck am I supposed to play this in co-op?
Why can't I pick out squads that haven't started yet? And then join and see do they speak english? This way, the game is just to erratic.

WRITING.TITLE: How can I join with other players BEFORE the mission starts?
WRITING.TEXT: I am sick of tired of being thrown in game with no context what the hell is happening. I just want to play a mission normally from start to finish.

WRITING.TITLE: The voice at the intro, who is that?
WRITING.TEXT:
My biggest let down during the campaign is that the awesome voice in the beginning, that gives you the Rip Tear advice, never shows up again. The only hint I could connect to it, is the hooded figure in this [image](http://i.imgur.com/ADhLht7.png) .
I looked up some lore, but I still can't find anything substantial.

WRITING.TITLE: Can somebody please explain me the random loading times? I just don't get it.
WRITING.TEXT:
Same player, same pc, same match, different loading times during rounds. How is that possible? In fact, I could swear that by just having a youtube video PAUSED makes the loading longer, I mean I have no hard science behind this, but it seems to me more and more that is the case.
Of course an SSD will make all this faster, but if the storage is the issue shouldn't then the loading time be consistent and not random? And besides I played with players who have r6 on SSD and they too experience long loading times, from time to time. Sometimes I load before they do!
As matter of fact, sometimes I just turn of all my browsers, and its almost as R6 loads faster, I am not so sure of this but it seems always like a safe bet. Keep in mind I am doing "nothing" on this browsers, I am not playing, uploading, downloading, its just some pages that are opened (Facebook, reddit, etc...) I have also speculated with some players, that just alt-tabing makes the load time longer.

WRITING.TITLE: Joe Rogan's explanation of why weed is illegal (hemp) doesn't explain enough for me.
WRITING.TEXT: Namely, why is it illegal in the entire world? I often asked myself this and could never find an answer, and the William Randolph Herst thing doesn't explain, why is weed illegal in Belarus.

WRITING.TITLE: Can somebody explain me the merits of the "undiet"?
WRITING.TEXT:
Its a very popular diet in former Yugoslavian countries, in short it goes like this:
- First day - Protein day - Second day - Starch day - Third day - Carbohydrate day - Fourth day - Fruits day
After the cycle of 74 days, or 29 days (three times during the diet) you will need to have a water day.
For more [detail](http://www.healthylifevision.com/un-diet-this-diet-lasts-for-90-days-and-you-will-lose-18-25-kilos/) .
Anyway, I really can't find much mention of it on English, and much less criticism. I have found only one non-english criticism by a nutritionist, which was kinda pointed out all the obvious flaws of it. For some reason, I get the name Meghan Telpner, when I search undiet, however that name (or any) is never mentioned on non-english sites. So I am a little confused there.
I mean, how are you supposed to be healthy and lose weight in healthy way, if you aren't supposed to have diverse meals every day. How are you supposed to have a healthy diet if you have a designated day for CARBS, CANDY and SWEETS!!! Then there are days where you are supposed to just drink water, what in the...
I am not a professional nutritionist, but to me this seems like a very dangerous diet for very desperate people, because it does work in the sense that you lose weight 15-20kg, but the price seems to be your health if you stick to it any longer. The diet also promises to "fasten your metabolism", that's just... ugh...
For some reason

WRITING.TITLE: Do you know a higher quality of this amazing TDKR trailer#2 track???
If GotG2 does not end up being the first MCU non-Iron Man movie to hit the 1B, what other MCU title will be the most likely to do it?
WRITING.TEXT:
I think there is a solid possibility of Iron Man being in the 1bil exclusive club for MCU until 2019, or rather when Avengers:IW2 ends. Because quite frankly GotG didn't really make all that much money worldwide when you think about it, I mean it did but it wasn't giant monster smash (it didn't reach 800mil), it also had weak contenders during August and September, of course it did help everyone liked it so it had those crazy legs.
But this time in weeks after its release it will face Arthur, Pirates of the Caribbean, Alien:Covenant, Baywatch, Wonder Woman, The Mummy, Cars 3, Transformers... None of this movies on their own, are a threat (except a surprise hit, there is always one surprise), but combined I think it will take out a lot of legs, + kids in schools. So it has to have a monster opening which is possible, but three weeks before Fate of the Furious comes out, so it might draw some of the air and fatigue with the audiences, not all of it of curse, but enough to make a dent. So my guess GoTG2 goes 400ish domestic and 900ish worldwide. FotF will definitely beat it, I have no doubt about that though. Also maybe 3 years took out of some that momentum, I am 90% sure if it released in 2016 it would have had a bigger opening. I think that, because the movie landscapes are changing QUICKLY, for example now people might associate an "cool 70s, 80s" in an big action blockbuster soundtrack as annoying trend.
EDIT: There is a way out for GoTG2, maybe it will be the year of summer ALPHA blockbusters, where will get a few *trump voice*HUGE blockbusters but a pile of bodies with a lot of box of bombs. Basically the box office will look like the [DOOM Marine](https://68.media.tumblr.com/35b651c42a1f6de921f0c21d564fa9c3/tumblr_o76xxyIPX41u9werno1_500.gif) past through it.
So let's see other possible MCU contenders, and why I am skeptical anybody will make it without Iron Man.
- Thor: Ragnarok, I don't think it can crack it, maybe if it is like a masterpiece and the Justice League ends being the biggest bomb in history. But I think this one has the closest chance. But really Thor is not a big draw, Chris Hemsworth is not a draw, Hulk is weird but on his own definitely not a draw.
- Spiderman: Homecoming has Iron Man so it is disqualified, but for fun sake I am mentioning it. Even with T.S. I am skeptical it can hit 1bil. In weeks leading up to it you have Transformers and Despicable Me 3 and the week after it War of the Planet of the Apes, and Spiderman has lost all his momentum that I don't think Civil War was enough to fix.
- Cap. Marvel, no fucking way, impossible. Even if it released in the week after the inauguration and used the women's march momentum, even then impossible.
- Black Panther, no fucking way, impossible. I can't spin in it into 1bil, simply not happening.
So what do you think? I feel like I missed a tittle though.
P.S. The summer is too stacked and overcrowded, and why aren't studios trying to take January, September and October with the heavy hitters, how many times do they have to learn the lesson of "hey, no competition, big bucks" that James Cameron thought them in 1997.

WRITING.TITLE: How do I add the "battle planner" to Prophecy of Pendor?
WRITING.TEXT:
I see that planner in a lot of mods, basically you get to plan your strategy before battle, and in the camp menu you can designate unit behavior after they get dismounted.
To be quite frank, I don't understand why isn't it already in PoP.

WRITING.TITLE: How much of an issue is the non-english literature?
WRITING.TEXT:
I have noticed that as time passes by, my knowledge gap between the British and non-British armies increases. In the last episode Indy is sad that that is just the sad reality.
But, that got me wondering, why is it that hard? I have no idea don't get me wrong, but I am wondering how much would it cost for them to pay for translations? They could probably even get some discounts if some fans did it. Any thoughts on this, because I feel like this is a damn shame to miss out on so much information, and you know what? I find the British least interesting, I already feel over-saturated with the British and the US representation in historical documentaries and other forms media, so it makes the great war less special when I can get the same info easily in other media. TGW felt like a great alternative in many regards, so I hoped that was to be case too, and IT IS to a degree. But there is room for improvement.
P.S. The episodes with the Turkish uniforms and about the Belgian king Albert were some of the most interesting to me because they opened up new frontiers to me.

WRITING.TITLE: Were there any "good" US presidents since Lincoln?
WRITING.TEXT:
I ask this because I am constantly befuddled when Americans start to talk about previous presidents. You mention one and somebody will always give arguments how he was absolutely terrible, not bad, but terrible. The last president that nobody really criticizes on a major scale is freakin' Lincoln. After him the game is on, republicans will say every democrat was the worst president ever and vice versa. Its really frustrating, and completely discourages me from that subject. Part of me thinks, these people are incapable of having complex thought and understand that there is a gray area for everything. That life is not red and blue.
I mention Lincoln because I thought that this only holds true for recent presidents, like of course people are gonna be salty about some of them, but no, it goes even as early to Teddy Roosevelt, so whenever I read or engage an discussion about commanders in chief, I see a huge polarization among people no matter how much time has passed.
Now, the reason I also find this confusing is because isn't the US kicking ass constantly since Woodrow Wilson? Like how could Reagan or Kennedy or Nixon or FDR or Eisenhower or any for that matter be THAT bad? It seems to me that the discussing American history is impossible without politics. Now I personally see a constant downward spiral in geopolitics since the first Bush to Obama, but I would not say all of them "destroyed" America and were absolutely horrible.
So what is in your opinion the last president after Lincoln that knocked it out of the park? In my humble opinion, its got be Woodrow, the man started the process of turning the US into a superpower, which was long overdue.

WRITING.TITLE: Has there been any "good" American president in the last 100-150 years?
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]

- The Deluge (M)
With Fire and Sword:

WRITING.TITLE: I yearn for the next "Empire Strikes Back" or "The Dark Knight"...
WRITING.TEXT:
We have been promised so many times by Hollywood marketing in last 5ish years that yeah this is the "TESB" or "TDK" of a certain franchise and then got promptly fucked over.
I've recently watched some scenes from the Dark Knight and kids reacting to the twist in Empire, and was thinking, damn we really need something like this again, there is way to many fake outs * *cough* * Age of Ultron * *cough* * or business as usual sequels.
So it would be refreshing to see a sequel that is so out of the ordinary and completely flips the switch, that actually feels dark and actually does have dark moments that make you feel sad or uncomfortable in a way.
EDIT: I forgot. Terminator 2, kind of fits into this. Its one also one of the best unexpected sequels ever, that changed the game and touched people.
P.S. Batman V Superman doesn't counts, because too many people didn't like it. I myself liked it a lot, but the death in that movie is a fake out, since we all know what is gonna happen after, it just had no weight.

WRITING.TITLE: How do I get and see my Skype name?
WRITING.TEXT: I am applying for something, and for some reason I need to have an Skype name, I have no idea what that is or to get it.

WRITING.TITLE: I just Realized that Doom is The video game Spiritual brother to Mad Max:Fury Road
WRITING.TEXT:
- Both are the fourth sequel that revived the long dead franchise.
- Both shocked and outraged at just how GOOD they were, usually these kind of sequels suck hard.
- Both have this hellish red hopeless lifeless aesthetic mixed with rugged machines
- Both have awesome kick-ass no non-sense soundtrack
- Both have awesome kick-ass no non-sense main character
- Both's protagonists are the not that proactive in the story and are usually guided by other characters
- Both have disgusting fat blobs
- Both have jumpy imp like annoying villain henchmen
- Both have the main villains with machine implants
- Both have an open ending.
Now, I am not deluded but there are many differences too, of course, but the "fourth sequel of this old badass property that is set in a hellish red dystopian future from times long past comes out of nowhere and kicks ass just like its protagonist" was impossible to not mention.
